1.text: And Job will add to take up his parable, and say,

2.text: God lives, he removed my judgment; and the Almighty embittered my soul;

3.text: For all the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God in my nose;

4.text: If my lips shall speak iniquity, and my tongue if it shall murmur deceit.

5.text: Far be it to me if I shall justify you: till I expire I will not remove my integrity from me.

6.text: My justice I held fast, and I will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach from my days.

7.text: Mine enemy shall be as the unjust one, and he rising up against me, as the evil one.

8.text: For what the hope of the profane one if he shall plunder? for God shall draw out his soul.

9.text: Will God hear his cry when straits shall come upon him?

10.text: If he will delight himself upon the Almighty? will he call upon God in all time?

11.text: I will teach you by the hand of God: what is with the Almighty I will not hide.

12.text: Behold, all ye yourselves saw; and wherefore this, will ye breathe out vanity?

13.text: This the portion of an unjust man with God, and the inheritance of the terrible they shall take from the Almighty.

14.text: If his sons shall be multiplied, for then the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

15.text: His surviving one shall be buried in death, and his widows shall not weep.

16.text: If he shall heap up silver as the dust, and prepare clothing as clay;

17.text: He shall prepare, and the just shall put on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

18.text: He built his house as the moth, and as a booth he watching made.

19.text: The rich one shall lie down, and he shall not be gathered: he opened his eyes, and he is not.

20.text: Terrors shall hedge him about as waters, the night a tempest stole him away.

21.text: The east wind shall lift him up, and he shall go: and it shall sweep him away in storm from his place.

22.text: For he shall cast upon him and not spare: fleeing, he will flee from his hand.

23.text: It shall be clapped upon him with their hands, and it shall be hissed upon him from his place.
